foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Wenn der Ertränker der Hoffnung ins Spiel kommt, bringe zwei 1/1 farblose Eldrazi-Brut-Kreaturenspielsteine ins Spiel. Sie haben „Opfere diese Kreatur: Erhöhe deinen Manavorrat um {1}."Opfere eine Eldrazi-Brut: Tappe eine Kreatur deiner Wahl.

foreignNames.name: Annegatore di Speranze
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Quando l'Annegatore di Speranze entra nel campo di battaglia, metti sul campo di battaglia due pedine creatura Discendente Eldrazi 1/1 incolori. Hanno "Sacrifica questa creatura: Aggiungi {1} alla tua riserva di mana".Sacrifica un Discendente Eldrazi: TAPpa una creatura bersaglio.

foreignNames.name: 希望を溺れさせるもの
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）希望を溺れさせるものが戦場に出たとき、無色の１/１のエルドラージ・末裔・クリーチャー・トークンを２体戦場に出す。それらは「このクリーチャーを生け贄に捧げる：あなたのマナ・プールに{1}を加える。」を持つ。エルドラージ・末裔を１体生け贄に捧げる：クリーチャー１体を対象とし、それをタップする。

foreignNames.name: 희망을 질식시키는 자
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)희망을 질식시키는 자가 전장에 들어올 때, 1/1 무색 엘드라지 자손 생물 토큰 두 개를 전장에 놓는다. 그 생물들은 "이 생물을 희생한다: 당신의 마나풀에 {1}을 담는다."를 가진다.엘드라지 자손을 희생한다: 생물을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물을 탭한다.

foreignNames.name: Afogador da Esperança
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)Quando Afogador da Esperança entrar no campo de batalha, coloque no campo de batalha duas fichas de criatura incolores 1/1 do tipo Rebento Eldrazi. Elas têm "Sacrifique esta criatura: Adicione {1} à sua reserva de mana."Sacrifique um Rebento Eldrazi: Vire a criatura alvo.

foreignNames.name: Топитель Надежды
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Когда Топитель Надежды выходит на поле битвы, положите на поле битвы две фишки существа 1/1 бесцветный Эльдрази Отпрыск. Они имеют способность «Пожертвуйте это существо: добавьте {1} в ваше хранилище маны».Пожертвуйте Эльдрази Отпрыска: поверните целевое существо.

foreignNames.name: Ahogador de esperanzas
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Cuando el Ahogador de esperanzas entre al campo de batalla, pon en el campo de batalla dos fichas de criatura Vástago Eldrazi incoloras 1/1. Tienen "Sacrificar esta criatura: Agrega {1} a tu reserva de maná".Sacrificar un Vástago Eldrazi: Gira la criatura objetivo.

cards.name: Drowner of Hope
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)When Drowner of Hope enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."Sacrifice an Eldrazi Scion: Tap target creature.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Eldrazi Scion to activate Drowner of Hope’s last ability, not just one created by Drowner of Hope.
You can’t sacrifice the same permanent to pay two different costs. Notably, if you sacrifice an Eldrazi Scion to activate the last ability of Drowner of Hope, you won’t add {1} to your mana pool.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
Eldrazi Scions are similar to Eldrazi Spawn, seen in the Zendikar block. Note that Eldrazi Scions are 1/1, not 0/1.
Eldrazi and Scion are each separate creature types. Anything that affects Eldrazi will affect these tokens, for example.
Sacrificing an Eldrazi Scion creature token to add {1} to your mana pool is a mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.

Some instants and sorceries that create Eldrazi Scions require targets. If all targets for such a spell have become illegal by the time that spell tries to resolve, the spell will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t get any Eldrazi Scions.

cards.text:

When Drowner of Hope enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."
Sacrifice an Eldrazi Scion: Tap target creature.

cards.text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Flying
When Eldrazi Skyspawner enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: "We are nothing but dust to them—our bodies, our actions, even our words."—Jori En, expedition leader

foreignNames.name: 可怖扭曲
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）反击目标总法术力费用等于或小于4的生物咒语。如果以此法反击该咒语，则改为将它放逐，而非置入其拥有者的坟墓场。
foreignNames.flavor: 「对它们而言，我们的一切都不过是尘土～躯体、行动，甚至是言语。」～探险队长裘黎恩

foreignNames.name: 可怖扭曲
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）反擊目標總魔法力費用等於或小於4的生物咒語。如果以此法反擊該咒語，則改為將它放逐，而非置入其擁有者的墳墓場。
foreignNames.flavor: 「對它們而言，我們的一切都不過是塵土～軀體、行動，甚至是言語。」～探險隊長裘黎恩

foreignNames.name: Mauvaise posture
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)Contrecarrez un sort de créature ciblé avec un coût converti de mana inférieur ou égal à 4. Si ce sort est contrecarré de cette manière, exilez-le à la place de le mettre dans le cimetière de son propriétaire.
foreignNames.flavor: « Nous ne sommes que poussière à leurs yeux... Nos corps, nos actes et même nos paroles. »—Jori En, chef d'expédition

foreignNames.name: Fürchterlicher Fehlschlag
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Neutralisiere einen Kreaturenzauber deiner Wahl mit umgewandelten Manakosten von 4 oder weniger. Falls der Zauberspruch auf diese Weise neutralisiert wird, schicke ihn ins Exil, anstatt ihn auf den Friedhof seines Besitzers zu legen.
foreignNames.flavor: „Wir sind nichts als Staub für sie – unsere Körper, unsere Taten, selbst unsere Worte."—Jori En, Expeditionsführer

foreignNames.name: Esito Orripilante
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Neutralizza una magia creatura bersaglio con costo di mana convertito pari o inferiore a 4. Se quella magia è neutralizzata in questo modo, esiliala invece di metterla nel cimitero del suo proprietario.
foreignNames.flavor: "Non siamo altro che polvere per loro. I nostri corpi, le nostre azioni, persino le nostre parole."—Jori En, capo spedizione

foreignNames.name: 手酷い失敗
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）点数で見たマナ・コストが４以下のクリーチャー・呪文１つを対象とし、それを打ち消す。その呪文がこれにより打ち消されたなら、それをオーナーの墓地に置く代わりに追放する。
foreignNames.flavor: 「あいつらにとって、私たちは塵のようなもの。肉体も、行動も、言葉でさえも。」——探検隊長、ジョリー・エン

foreignNames.name: 끔찍한 실패
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)전환마나비용이 4 이하인 생물 주문을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물 주문을 무효화한다. 이렇게 그 주문이 무효화되면 그 카드를 소유자의 무덤에 넣는 대신 추방한다.
foreignNames.flavor: "우리는 그들에게 먼지 같은 존재야. 우리의 몸, 행동, 심지어 말도 아무 소용 없어."—탐험대 대장 조리 엔

foreignNames.name: Terrivelmente Errado
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)Anule a mágica de criatura alvo com custo de mana convertido igual ou inferior a 4. Se aquela mágica for anulada dessa maneira, exile-a em vez de colocá-la no cemitério de seu dono.
foreignNames.flavor: "Não passamos de pó para eles — nossos corpos, nossas ações, até mesmo nossas palavras."— Jori En, líder de expedição

foreignNames.name: Нелепое Искажение
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Отмените целевое заклинание существа с конвертированной мана-стоимостью не более 4. Если то заклинание отменяется таким образом, изгоните его вместо того, чтобы положить его на кладбище его владельца.
foreignNames.flavor: «Мы для них всего лишь прах — наши тела, наши действия и даже наши слова».— Джори-Эн, глава экспедиции

foreignNames.name: Fracaso rotundo
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Contrarresta el hechizo de criatura objetivo con coste de maná convertido de 4 o menos. Si ese hechizo es contrarrestado de esta manera, exílialo en vez de ponerlo en el cementerio de su propietario.
foreignNames.flavor: "Para ellos no somos nada más que polvo: nuestros cuerpos, nuestras acciones, incluso nuestras palabras".—Jori En, líder de expedición

cards.name: Horribly Awry
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)Counter target creature spell with converted mana cost 4 or less. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of a spell doesn’t change if its controller paid an alternative cost (such as an evoke cost) to cast it.

foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）培養ドローンが戦場に出たとき、無色の１/１のエルドラージ・末裔・クリーチャー・トークンを１体戦場に出す。それは「このクリーチャーを生け贄に捧げる：あなたのマナ・プールに{1}を加える。」を持つ。

foreignNames.name: 迷雾侵体
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）飞行摄食（每当此生物对任一牌手造成战斗伤害时，该牌手放逐其牌库顶牌。）
foreignNames.flavor: 荒芜如疾风般飞速蔓延。

foreignNames.name: 迷霧侵體
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）飛行攝食（每當此生物對任一玩家造成戰鬥傷害時，該玩家放逐其牌庫頂牌。）

foreignNames.name: Intrus des brumes
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)VolIngestion (À chaque fois que cette créature inflige des blessures de combat à un joueur, ce joueur exile la carte du dessus de sa bibliothèque.)

foreignNames.name: Nebel-Eindringling
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)FliegendZehren (Immer wenn diese Kreatur einem Spieler Kampfschaden zufügt, schickt dieser Spieler die oberste Karte seiner Bibliothek ins Exil.)

foreignNames.name: Invasore delle Brume
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)VolareIngerire (Ogniqualvolta questa creatura infligge danno da combattimento a un giocatore, quel giocatore esilia la prima carta del suo grimorio.)

foreignNames.name: 霧の侵入者
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）飛行嚥下（このクリーチャーがプレイヤー１人に戦闘ダメージを与えるたび、そのプレイヤーは自分のライブラリーの一番上のカードを追放する。）
foreignNames.flavor: 風のごとく瞬く間に荒廃は拡がる。

foreignNames.name: 안개 침입자

foreignNames.flavor: 황무지는 바람처럼 빨리 퍼져나간다.

foreignNames.name: Intruso da Névoa
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)VoarIngerir (Toda vez que esta criatura causa dano de combate a um jogador, ele exila o card do topo do próprio grimório.)

foreignNames.name: Туманный Захватчик
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)ПолетЗаглатывание (Каждый раз, когда это существо наносит боевые повреждения игроку, тот игрок изгоняет верхнюю карту своей библиотеки.)
foreignNames.flavor: Опустошение разносится так же быстро, как ветер.

foreignNames.name: Intruso de la niebla
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Vuela.Ingerir. (Siempre que esta criatura haga daño de combate a un jugador, ese jugador exilia la primera carta de su biblioteca.)
foreignNames.flavor: La desolación se extiende tan rápido como el viento.

cards.name: Mist Intruder
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)FlyingIngest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
The card exiled by the ingest ability is exiled face up.
If the player has no cards in his or her library when the ingest ability resolves, nothing happens. That player won’t lose the game (until he or she has to draw a card from an empty library).

Devoid (This card has no color.)
Flying
Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)

foreignNames.name: 暗沼神行体
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）当暗沼神行体进战场时，你可以将一张由对手拥有的牌从放逐区置入该玩家的坟墓场。若你如此作，则将目标生物移回其拥有者手上。
foreignNames.flavor: 你能看到它时，就已经太迟了。

foreignNames.name: 暗沼神行體
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）當暗沼神行體進戰場時，你可以將一張由對手擁有的牌從放逐區置入該玩家的墳墓場。若你如此作，則將目標生物移回其擁有者手上。
foreignNames.flavor: 你能看到它時，就已經太遲了。

foreignNames.name: Enjambeur des eaux troubles
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)Quand l'Enjambeur des eaux troubles arrive sur le champ de bataille, vous pouvez mettre une carte qu'un adversaire possède dans le cimetière de ce joueur depuis l'exil. Si vous faites ainsi, renvoyez une créature ciblée dans la main de son propriétaire.
foreignNames.flavor: Si vous le voyez, c'est qu'il est déjà trop tard.

foreignNames.name: Trübnisschreiter
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Wenn der Trübnisschreiter ins Spiel kommt, kannst du eine Karte, die ein Gegner besitzt, aus dem Exil auf den Friedhof dieses Spielers legen. Falls du dies tust, bringe eine Kreatur deiner Wahl auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück.
foreignNames.flavor: Wenn du ihn sehen kannst, ist es bereits zu spät.

foreignNames.name: Ramingo dell'Oscurità
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Quando il Ramingo dell'Oscurità entra nel campo di battaglia, puoi mettere una carta posseduta da un avversario dall'esilio nel cimitero di quel giocatore. Se lo fai, fai tornare una creatura bersaglio in mano al suo proprietario.
foreignNames.flavor: Se riesci a vederlo, è troppo tardi.

foreignNames.name: 霞の徘徊者
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）霞の徘徊者が戦場に出たとき、クリーチャー１体を対象とする。あなたは追放領域から対戦相手がオーナーであるカードを１枚そのプレイヤーの墓地に置いてもよい。そうしたなら、そのクリーチャーをオーナーの手札に戻す。
foreignNames.flavor: それが見えた時は、すでに手遅れだ。

foreignNames.name: 수렁 보행자
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)수렁 보행자가 전장에 들어올 때, 당신은 추방 영역에서 상대가 소유한 카드 한 장을 그 플레이어의 무덤에 넣을 수 있다. 그렇게 한다면, 생물을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물을 소유자의 손으로 되돌린다.
foreignNames.flavor: 그것을 볼 수 있다면, 이미 늦은 것이다.

foreignNames.name: Andarilho do Lodo
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)Quando Andarilho do Lodo entra no campo de batalha, você pode colocar um card exilado de um oponente no cemitério dele. Se fizer isso, devolva a criatura alvo para a mão de seu dono.
foreignNames.flavor: Se você consegue vê-lo, é tarde demais.

foreignNames.name: Мракомерка
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Когда Мракомерка выходит на поле битвы, вы можете положить принадлежащую оппоненту карту из изгнания на кладбище того игрока. Если вы это делаете, верните целевое существо в руку владельца.
foreignNames.flavor: Если вы ее видите, то уже слишком поздно.

foreignNames.name: Zancudo lóbrego
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Cuando el Zancudo lóbrego entre al campo de batalla, puedes poner en el cementerio de un oponente una carta del exilio de la que ese jugador sea propietario. Si lo haces, regresa la criatura objetivo a la mano de su propietario.
foreignNames.flavor: Si puedes verlo, ya es demasiado tarde.

cards.name: Murk Strider
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)When Murk Strider enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the target creature becomes illegal before the triggered ability resolves, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t “process” a card in exile.
Players can respond to the triggered ability, but once it starts resolving and you decide whether to put a card from exile into the player’s graveyard, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
If a spell or ability requires that you put more than one exiled card into the graveyard, you may choose cards owned by different opponents. Each card chosen will be put into its owner’s graveyard.

If a replacement effect will cause cards that would be put into a graveyard from anywhere to be exiled instead (such as the one created by Anafenza, the Foremost), you can still put an exiled card into its opponent’s graveyard. The card becomes a new object and remains in exile. In this situation, you can’t use a single exiled card if required to put more than one exiled card into the graveyard. Conversely, you could use the same card in this situation if two separate spells or abilities each required you to put a single exiled card into its owner’s graveyard.
You can’t look at face-down cards in exile unless an effect allows you to.

Face-down cards in exile are grouped using two criteria: what caused them to be exiled face down and when they were exiled face down. If you want to put a face-down card in exile into its owner’s graveyard, you must first choose one of these groups and then choose a card from within that group at random. For example, say an artifact causes your opponent to exile his or her hand of three cards face down. Then on a later turn, that artifact causes your opponent to exile another two cards face down. If you use Wasteland Strangler to put one of those cards into his or her graveyard, you would pick the first or second pile and put a card chosen at random from that pile into the graveyard.

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
If a spell or ability requires that you put more than one exiled card into the graveyard, you may choose cards owned by different opponents. Each card chosen will be put into its owner’s graveyard.

If a replacement effect will cause cards that would be put into a graveyard from anywhere to be exiled instead (such as the one created by Anafenza, the Foremost), you can still put an exiled card into its opponent’s graveyard. The card becomes a new object and remains in exile. In this situation, you can’t use a single exiled card if required to put more than one exiled card into the graveyard. Conversely, you could use the same card in this situation if two separate spells or abilities each required you to put a single exiled card into its owner’s graveyard.
You can’t look at face-down cards in exile unless an effect allows you to.

Face-down cards in exile are grouped using two criteria: what caused them to be exiled face down and when they were exiled face down. If you want to put a face-down card in exile into its owner’s graveyard, you must first choose one of these groups and then choose a card from within that group at random. For example, say an artifact causes your opponent to exile his or her hand of three cards face down. Then on a later turn, that artifact causes your opponent to exile another two cards face down. If you use Wasteland Strangler to put one of those cards into his or her graveyard, you would pick the first or second pile and put a card chosen at random from that pile into the graveyard.

cards.name: Brilliant Spectrum
cards.originalText: Converge — Draw X cards, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Brilliant Spectrum. Then discard two cards.

rulings.text: The maximum number of colors of mana you can spend to cast a spell is five. Colorless is not a color. Note that the cost of a spell with converge may limit how many colors of mana you can spend.

If there are any alternative or additional costs to cast a spell with a converge ability, the mana spent to pay those costs will count. For example, if an effect makes sorcery spells cost {1} more to cast, you could pay {W}{U}{B}{R} to cast Radiant Flames and deal 4 damage to each creature.

If you cast a spell with converge without spending any mana to cast it (perhaps because an effect allowed you to cast it without paying its mana cost), then the number of colors spent to cast it will be zero.

If a spell with a converge ability is copied, no mana was spent to cast the copy, so the number of colors of mana spent to cast the spell will be zero. The number of colors spent to cast the original spell is not copied.

cards.text: Converge — Draw X cards, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Brilliant Spectrum. Then discard two cards.

cards.name: Clutch of Currents
cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.Awaken 3—{4}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{U}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

rulings.text: You can cast a spell with awaken for its mana cost and get only its first effect. If you cast a spell for its awaken cost, you’ll get both effects.

If the non-awaken part of the spell requires a target, you must choose a legal target. You can’t cast the spell if you can’t choose a legal target for each instance of the word “target” (though you only need a legal target for the awaken ability if you’re casting the spell for its awaken cost).

If a spell with awaken has multiple targets (including the land you control), and some but not all of those targets become illegal by the time the spell tries to resolve, the spell won’t affect the illegal targets in any way.

If the non-awaken part of the spell doesn’t require a target and you cast the spell for its awaken cost, then the spell will be countered if the target land you control becomes illegal before the spell resolves (such as due to being destroyed in response to the spell being cast).

The land will retain any other types, subtypes, or supertypes it previously had. It will also retain any mana abilities it had as a result of those subtypes. For example, a Forest that’s turned into a creature this way can still be tapped for {G}.
Awaken doesn’t give the land you control a color. As most lands are colorless, in most cases the resulting land creature will also be colorless.

foreignNames.flavor: 「我認為應該消滅奧札奇。烏金想讓它們回歸靜態。烏金的理由...說服不了我。」～傑斯貝連

foreignNames.name: Dispersement
foreignNames.text: Contrecarrez le sort d'éphémère ciblé.
foreignNames.flavor: « J'ai dit qu'il fallait détruire les Eldrazi. Ugin voulait les renvoyer en stase. Ses arguments n'étaient... pas très convaincants. »—Jace Beleren

foreignNames.name: Bannzauber
foreignNames.text: Neutralisiere einen Spontanzauber deiner Wahl.
foreignNames.flavor: „Ich sagte, wir sollten die Eldrazi zerstören. Ugin wollte sie zurück in ihre Stasis versetzen. Ugins Argumente waren … nicht überzeugend."—Jace Beleren

foreignNames.name: Sfatare
foreignNames.text: Neutralizza una magia istantaneo bersaglio.
foreignNames.flavor: "Io ero convinto che avremmo dovuto distruggere gli Eldrazi. Ugin voleva farli tornare in stasi. Le sue argomentazioni si sono dimostrate... poco convincenti."—Jace Beleren

foreignNames.name: 払拭
foreignNames.text: インスタント・呪文１つを対象とし、それを打ち消す。
foreignNames.flavor: 「エルドラージは滅ぼさねばならないと言ったはずだ。ウギンは再度封印しようと言うが、その主張には説得力がない。」——ジェイス・ベレレン

foreignNames.name: 주문해제
foreignNames.text: 순간마법 주문을 목표로 정한다. 그 주문을 무효화한다.
foreignNames.flavor: "난 엘드라지를 물리쳐야 한다고 말했어. 하지만 우진은 그 놈들이 갇혀 있던 상태로 되돌리길 원했지. 우진의 주장은 . . . 설득력이 없었어."—제이스 벨레렌

foreignNames.name: Delir
foreignNames.text: Anule a mágica instantânea alvo.
foreignNames.flavor: "Eu disse que devíamos destruir os Eldrazi. Ugin queria colocá-los novamente em estase. Os argumentos dele... não foram convincentes."— Jace Beleren

foreignNames.name: Рассеять
foreignNames.text: Отмените целевое мгновенное заклинание.
foreignNames.flavor: «Я сказал, что мы должны уничтожить Эльдрази. Уджин хотел вновь погрузить их в сон. Но доводы Уджина оказались... неубедительными».— Джейс Белерен

foreignNames.name: Esfumar
foreignNames.text: Contrarresta el hechizo instantáneo objetivo.
foreignNames.flavor: "Yo dije que debíamos destruir a los Eldrazi. Ugin quería devolverlos a un estado de estasis. Los argumentos de Ugin fueron... poco convincentes".—Jace Beleren

cards.name: Dispel
cards.originalText: Counter target instant spell.
cards.text: Counter target instant spell.

cards.flavor: "I can't control its mind—I'm not even sure it has one. But I can dominate its will."

foreignNames.name: 加以感化
foreignNames.text: 聚辉～如果目标生物的力量等于或小于施放加以感化时用来支付费用的法术力颜色数量，则获得该生物的操控权。
foreignNames.flavor: 「我无法操控它的心灵，我甚至不确定它是否有心灵。但我能主宰它的意志。」

foreignNames.name: 加以感化
foreignNames.text: 聚輝～如果目標生物的力量等於或小於施放加以感化時用來支付費用的魔法力顏色數量，則獲得該生物的操控權。
foreignNames.flavor: 「我無法操控它的心靈，我甚至不確定它是否有心靈。但我能主宰它的意志。」

foreignNames.name: Exercice d'influence
foreignNames.text: Convergence — Acquérez le contrôle d'une créature ciblée si sa force est inférieure ou égale au nombre de couleurs de mana dépensé pour lancer l'Exercice d'influence.
foreignNames.flavor: « Je ne peux pas contrôler son esprit... Je ne suis même pas sûre qu'il en ait un. Mais je peux soumettre sa volonté. »

foreignNames.name: Einfluss ausüben
foreignNames.text: Konvergenz — Übernimm die Kontrolle über eine Kreatur deiner Wahl, falls ihre Stärke kleiner oder gleich der Anzahl an unterschiedlichen Farben von Mana ist, das ausgegeben wurde, um Einfluss ausüben zu wirken.
foreignNames.flavor: „Ich kann sein Bewusstsein nicht kontrollieren – vielleicht hat es gar keines. Aber ich kann seinen Willen beherrschen."

foreignNames.name: Esercitare Influenza
foreignNames.text: Convergenza — Prendi il controllo di una creatura bersaglio se la sua forza è pari o inferiore al numero di colori di mana spesi per lanciare Esercitare Influenza.
foreignNames.flavor: "Non posso controllare la sua mente. Non sono neanche sicura che ne abbia una. Ma posso dominare la sua volontà."

foreignNames.name: 影響力の行使
foreignNames.text: 収斂 — クリーチャー１体を対象とする。それのパワーが影響力の行使を唱えるために支払われたマナの色の総数以下であるなら、それのコントロールを得る。
foreignNames.flavor: 「心を操るわけではありません。そもそも、あれに心があるかどうかも分かりません。私はあれの意思を支配するんです。」

foreignNames.name: 영향력 행사
foreignNames.text: 화합 — 생물을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물의 공격력이 영향력 행사를 발동하는 데 지불한 마나의 색 종류 수 이하이면 그 생물의 조종권을 얻는다.
foreignNames.flavor: "그 놈의 정신을 조종할 수 없어. 조종할 정신이 있기나 한 건지 모르겠군. 하지만 그 놈의 의지는 지배할 수 있지."

foreignNames.name: Exercer Influência
foreignNames.text: Convergir — Ganhe o controle da criatura alvo se o poder dela for igual ou inferior ao número de cores de mana gasto para conjurar Exercer Influência.
foreignNames.flavor: "Eu não posso controlar a mente dele — sequer tenho certeza de que ele possua uma. Mas eu posso dominar a vontade dele."

foreignNames.name: Проявление Влияния
foreignNames.text: Схождение — Получите контроль над целевым существом, если значение его силы не превышает число цветов маны, потраченной на разыгрывание Проявления Влияния.
foreignNames.flavor: «Я не могу управлять его разумом. Не уверена даже, что у него вообще есть разум. Но я могу подавить его волю».

foreignNames.name: Influir
foreignNames.text: Converger — Gana el control de la criatura objetivo si su fuerza es menor o igual a la cantidad de colores de maná usados para lanzar Influir.
foreignNames.flavor: "No puedo controlar su mente; quizás ni siquiera la tenga. Pero puedo controlar su voluntad".

cards.name: Exert Influence
cards.originalText: Converge — Gain control of target creature if its power is less than or equal to the number of colors of mana spent to cast Exert Influence.

rulings.text: Check the creature’s power as Exert Influence resolves to see if it’s less than or equal to the number of colors spent to cast Exert Influence. If it’s greater, Exert Influence will finish resolving with no effect.
Once you’ve gained control of a creature with Exert Influence, it doesn’t matter what happens to its power. Raising it won’t cause the control-changing effect to end.
The maximum number of colors of mana you can spend to cast a spell is five. Colorless is not a color. Note that the cost of a spell with converge may limit how many colors of mana you can spend.

If there are any alternative or additional costs to cast a spell with a converge ability, the mana spent to pay those costs will count. For example, if an effect makes sorcery spells cost {1} more to cast, you could pay {W}{U}{B}{R} to cast Radiant Flames and deal 4 damage to each creature.

If you cast a spell with converge without spending any mana to cast it (perhaps because an effect allowed you to cast it without paying its mana cost), then the number of colors spent to cast it will be zero.

If a spell with a converge ability is copied, no mana was spent to cast the copy, so the number of colors of mana spent to cast the spell will be zero. The number of colors spent to cast the original spell is not copied.

cards.text: Converge — Gain control of target creature if its power is less than or equal to the number of colors of mana spent to cast Exert Influence.

foreignNames.name: 塔晋守护者
foreignNames.text: 飞行地落～每当一个地在你的操控下进战场时，横置目标由对手操控的生物。若该地是海岛，则该生物于其操控者的下一个重置步骤中不能重置。

foreignNames.name: 塔晉守護者

foreignNames.name: Vigile de Tazeem

foreignNames.name: Guardiano di Tazeem

foreignNames.name: タジームの守護者

foreignNames.name: 타짐의 수호자
foreignNames.text: 비행대지력 — 대지가 당신의 조종하에 전장에 들어올 때마다, 상대가 조종하는 생물을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물을 탭한다. 그 대지가 섬이라면, 그 생물은 조종자의 다음 언탭단에 언탭되지 않는다.

foreignNames.name: Guardião de Tazeem

foreignNames.name: Защитник Тазима

foreignNames.name: Guardián de Tazeem

cards.name: Guardian of Tazeem
cards.originalText: FlyingLandfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls. If that land is an Island, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: Guardian of Tazeem’s landfall ability can target a creature that’s already tapped. If the land that caused it to trigger was an Island, that creature won’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.

The ability tracks the creature, but not its controller. If the creature changes controllers before its first controller’s next untap step has come around, then it won’t untap during its new controller’s next untap step.

A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

Sigue siendo una tierra).

cards.name: Part the Waterveil
cards.originalText: Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Part the Waterveil.Awaken 6—{6}{U}{U}{U} (If you cast this spell for {6}{U}{U}{U}, also put six +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

rulings.text: Exiling Part the Waterveil is part of its effect. If Part the Waterveil is countered, including if it was cast for its awaken cost and the land you control became an illegal target, it will be put into its owner’s graveyard.
You can cast a spell with awaken for its mana cost and get only its first effect. If you cast a spell for its awaken cost, you’ll get both effects.

If the non-awaken part of the spell requires a target, you must choose a legal target. You can’t cast the spell if you can’t choose a legal target for each instance of the word “target” (though you only need a legal target for the awaken ability if you’re casting the spell for its awaken cost).

If a spell with awaken has multiple targets (including the land you control), and some but not all of those targets become illegal by the time the spell tries to resolve, the spell won’t affect the illegal targets in any way.

If the non-awaken part of the spell doesn’t require a target and you cast the spell for its awaken cost, then the spell will be countered if the target land you control becomes illegal before the spell resolves (such as due to being destroyed in response to the spell being cast).

The land will retain any other types, subtypes, or supertypes it previously had. It will also retain any mana abilities it had as a result of those subtypes. For example, a Forest that’s turned into a creature this way can still be tapped for {G}.
Awaken doesn’t give the land you control a color. As most lands are colorless, in most cases the resulting land creature will also be colorless.

rulings.text: The maximum number of colors of mana you can spend to cast a spell is five. Colorless is not a color. Note that the cost of a spell with converge may limit how many colors of mana you can spend.

If there are any alternative or additional costs to cast a spell with a converge ability, the mana spent to pay those costs will count. For example, if an effect makes sorcery spells cost {1} more to cast, you could pay {W}{U}{B}{R} to cast Radiant Flames and deal 4 damage to each creature.

If you cast a spell with converge without spending any mana to cast it (perhaps because an effect allowed you to cast it without paying its mana cost), then the number of colors spent to cast it will be zero.

If a spell with a converge ability is copied, no mana was spent to cast the copy, so the number of colors of mana spent to cast the spell will be zero. The number of colors spent to cast the original spell is not copied.

cards.name: Retreat to Coralhelm
cards.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —• You may tap or untap target creature.• Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.name: Rush of Ice
cards.originalText: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.Awaken 3—{4}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{U}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

rulings.text: Rush of Ice can target a creature that’s already tapped. It still won’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.

Rush of Ice tracks the creature, but not its controller. If the creature changes controllers before its first controller’s next untap step has come around, then it won’t untap during its new controller’s next untap step.
You can cast a spell with awaken for its mana cost and get only its first effect. If you cast a spell for its awaken cost, you’ll get both effects.

If the non-awaken part of the spell requires a target, you must choose a legal target. You can’t cast the spell if you can’t choose a legal target for each instance of the word “target” (though you only need a legal target for the awaken ability if you’re casting the spell for its awaken cost).

If a spell with awaken has multiple targets (including the land you control), and some but not all of those targets become illegal by the time the spell tries to resolve, the spell won’t affect the illegal targets in any way.

If the non-awaken part of the spell doesn’t require a target and you cast the spell for its awaken cost, then the spell will be countered if the target land you control becomes illegal before the spell resolves (such as due to being destroyed in response to the spell being cast).

The land will retain any other types, subtypes, or supertypes it previously had. It will also retain any mana abilities it had as a result of those subtypes. For example, a Forest that’s turned into a creature this way can still be tapped for {G}.
Awaken doesn’t give the land you control a color. As most lands are colorless, in most cases the resulting land creature will also be colorless.

cards.name: Wave-Wing Elemental
cards.originalText: FlyingLandfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Wave-Wing Elemental gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

Whenever Windrider Patrol deals combat damage to a player, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: "We returned to the field and found poor Len, every detail of his final moment perfectly cast in that awful dust."—Javad Nasrin, outrider captain

foreignNames.name: 彻底忽视
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）放逐目标力量等于或小于3的生物。
foreignNames.flavor: 「我们回到战场，发现了可怜的莱恩，他临终前的动作完美地印刻在那堆可怕的尘土中。」～前导兵队长贾维纳金

foreignNames.name: 徹底忽視
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）放逐目標力量等於或小於3的生物。
foreignNames.flavor: 「我們回到戰場，發現了可憐的萊恩，他臨終前的動作完美地印刻在那堆可怕的塵土中。」～前導兵隊長賈維納金

foreignNames.name: Mépris absolu
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)Exilez la créature ciblée de force inférieure ou égale à 3.
foreignNames.flavor: « Nous avons retrouvé le pauvre Len. Tous les détails de ses derniers instants étaient parfaitement moulés dans cette horrible poussière. »—Javad Nasrin, capitaine cavalière

foreignNames.name: Völlige Geringschätzung
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Schicke eine Kreatur deiner Wahl mit Stärke 3 oder weniger ins Exil.
foreignNames.flavor: „Wir kehrten zurück und fanden den armen Len, jedes Detail seines schmerzhaften Ablebens perfekt in diesen schrecklichen Staub gezeichnet."—Javad Nasrin, Vorreiter-Hauptmann

foreignNames.name: Completo Disinteresse
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Esilia una creatura bersaglio con forza pari o inferiore a 3.
foreignNames.flavor: "Tornammo sul campo e trovammo il povero Len, ogni dettaglio dei suoi ultimi istanti impresso chiaramente in quell'orribile polvere."—Javad Nasrin, capitano battipista

foreignNames.name: 完全無視
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）パワーが３以下のクリーチャー１体を対象とし、それを追放する。
foreignNames.flavor: 「レンを探しに現場に戻った。あいつの最期の瞬間が、細部にいたるまで塵で象られて残っていた。」——先導隊長、ジャヴァド・ナスリン

foreignNames.name: 완전한 무시
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)공격력이 3 이하인 생물을 목표로 정한다. 그 생물을 추방한다.
foreignNames.flavor: "우리는 전장으로 돌아와 불쌍한 렌을 발견했네. 그 끔찍한 먼지가 그의 마지막 순간을 완벽하게 보존하고 있었어."—선두 기수 대장 자바드 나스린

foreignNames.name: Negligência Completa
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)Exile a criatura alvo com poder igual ou inferior a 3.
foreignNames.flavor: "Voltamos para o campo e encontramos o pobre Len, com cada detalhe de seu último momento impresso perfeitamente naquele pó terrível."— Javad Nasrin, capitã vanguardeira

foreignNames.name: Полное Пренебрежение
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Изгоните целевое существо с силой 3 или меньше.
foreignNames.flavor: «Мы вернулись на поле и нашли беднягу Лена. Его последние мгновения были в деталях запечатлены в этом ужасном прахе».— Джавад Назрин, капитан наездников

foreignNames.name: Indiferencia absoluta
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Exilia la criatura objetivo con fuerza de 3 o menos.
foreignNames.flavor: "Regresamos al terreno y allá encontramos al pobre Len. Cada instante de su momento final había quedado esculpido en ese horrible polvo".—Javad Nasrin, capitana de batidores

cards.name: Complete Disregard
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)Exile target creature with power 3 or less.

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.

cards.text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Exile target creature with power 3 or less.

cards.flavor: Silence rules Bala Ged, broken only by the skittering of Eldrazi.

foreignNames.name: 牲祭奴兽
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）摄食（每当此生物对任一牌手造成战斗伤害时，该牌手放逐其牌库顶牌。）
foreignNames.flavor: 巴勒格一片寂静，只剩奥札奇来去的声音。

foreignNames.name: 牲祭奴獸
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）攝食（每當此生物對任一玩家造成戰鬥傷害時，該玩家放逐其牌庫頂牌。）
foreignNames.flavor: 巴勒格一片寂靜，只剩奧札奇來去的聲音。

foreignNames.name: Drone du sacrifice
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)Ingestion (À chaque fois que cette créature inflige des blessures de combat à un joueur, ce joueur exile la carte du dessus de sa bibliothèque.)
foreignNames.flavor: Le silence qui règne sur Bala Ged n'est brisé que par les frémissements des Eldrazi.

foreignNames.name: Ausmerzer-Drohne
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Zehren (Immer wenn diese Kreatur einem Spieler Kampfschaden zufügt, schickt dieser Spieler die oberste Karte seiner Bibliothek ins Exil.)
foreignNames.flavor: Stille herrscht in Bala Ged. Nur manchmal ist das Krabbeln eines dahinjagenden Eldrazi zu hören.

foreignNames.name: Parassita Vagliatore
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Ingerire (Ogniqualvolta questa creatura infligge danno da combattimento a un giocatore, quel giocatore esilia la prima carta del suo grimorio.)
foreignNames.flavor: Il silenzio regna su Bala Ged, rotto solo dal brulicare degli Eldrazi.

foreignNames.name: 淘汰ドローン
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）嚥下（このクリーチャーがプレイヤー１人に戦闘ダメージを与えるたび、そのプレイヤーは自分のライブラリーの一番上のカードを追放する。）
foreignNames.flavor: バーラ・ゲドは静寂に包まれており、ときおりエルドラージの通る音がするのみであった。

foreignNames.name: 선별하는 드론
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)섭식 (이 생물이 플레이어에게 전투피해를 입힐 때마다, 그 플레이어는 자신의 서고 맨 위의 카드를 추방한다.)
foreignNames.flavor: 발라 게드는 엘드라지의 공격이 있을 때를 제외하고는 항상 침묵이 지배한다.

foreignNames.name: Zangão Seletor
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)Ingerir (Toda vez que esta criatura causa dano de combate a um jogador, ele exila o card do topo do próprio grimório.)
foreignNames.flavor: O silêncio reina em Bala Ged, sendo quebrado apenas pela agitação dos Eldrazi.

foreignNames.name: Дрон-Выбраковщик
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Заглатывание (Каждый раз, когда это существо наносит боевые повреждения игроку, тот игрок изгоняет верхнюю карту своей библиотеки.)
foreignNames.flavor: В Бала-Геде царит тишина, нарушаемая лишь шумом рыскающих Эльдрази.

foreignNames.name: Zángano supervisor
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)Ingerir. (Siempre que esta criatura haga daño de combate a un jugador, ese jugador exilia la primera carta de su biblioteca.)
foreignNames.flavor: El silencio reina en Bala Ged; solo queda roto por el sonido de los Eldrazi al deslizarse.

cards.name: Culling Drone
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
The card exiled by the ingest ability is exiled face up.
If the player has no cards in his or her library when the ingest ability resolves, nothing happens. That player won’t lose the game (until he or she has to draw a card from an empty library).

cards.name: Dominator Drone
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)When Dominator Drone enters the battlefield, if you control another colorless creature, each opponent loses 2 life.

rulings.text: Dominator Drone’s last ability checks to see if you control another colorless creature at the moment it enters the battlefield. If you don’t, the ability won’t trigger at all. If you do, the ability will check again as it tries to resolve. If you no longer control another colorless creature, the ability will be removed from the stack and have no effect.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
The card exiled by the ingest ability is exiled face up.
If the player has no cards in his or her library when the ingest ability resolves, nothing happens. That player won’t lose the game (until he or she has to draw a card from an empty library).

When Dominator Drone enters the battlefield, if you control another colorless creature, each opponent loses 2 life.

foreignNames.name: 生自墓穴
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）目标对手从其坟墓场放逐一张牌。你将一个1/1无色奥札奇／孽裔衍生生物放进战场。它具有「牺牲此生物：加{1}到你的法术力池中。」抓一张牌。

foreignNames.name: 生自墓穴
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）目標對手從其墳墓場放逐一張牌。你將一個1/1無色奧札奇／孽裔衍生生物放進戰場。它具有「犧牲此生物：加{1}到你的魔法力池中。」抽一張牌。

foreignNames.name: Gestation de la tombe
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)L'adversaire ciblé exile une carte depuis son cimetière. Vous mettez sur le champ de bataille un jeton de créature 1/1 incolore Eldrazi et Scion. Il a « Sacrifiez cette créature : Ajoutez {1} à votre réserve. »Piochez une carte.

foreignNames.name: Grabgeburt
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Ein Gegner deiner Wahl schickt eine Karte aus seinem Friedhof ins Exil. Du bringst einen 1/1 farblosen Eldrazi-Brut-Kreaturenspielstein ins Spiel. Er hat „Opfere diese Kreatur: Erhöhe deinen Manavorrat um {1}."Ziehe eine Karte.

foreignNames.name: Nascita Sepolcrale
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Un avversario bersaglio esilia una carta dal suo cimitero. Metti sul campo di battaglia una pedina creatura Discendente Eldrazi 1/1 incolore. Ha "Sacrifica questa creatura: Aggiungi {1} alla tua riserva di mana".Pesca una carta.

foreignNames.name: 墓の出産
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）対戦相手１人を対象とする。そのプレイヤーは自分の墓地からカードを１枚追放する。あなたは無色の１/１のエルドラージ・末裔・クリーチャー・トークンを１体戦場に出す。それは「このクリーチャーを生け贄に捧げる：あなたのマナ・プールに{1}を加える。」を持つ。カードを１枚引く。

foreignNames.name: 무덤 부화
foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)상대를 목표로 정한다. 그 상대는 자신의 무덤에서 카드 한 장을 추방한다. 당신은 1/1 무색 엘드라지 자손 생물 토큰 한 개를 전장에 놓는다. 그 생물은 "이 생물을 희생한다: 당신의 마나풀에 {1}을 담는다."를 가진다.카드 한 장을 뽑는다.

foreignNames.name: Nascimento Tumular
foreignNames.text: Desprovido (Este card não tem cor.)O oponente alvo exila um card do próprio cemitério. Você coloca no campo de batalha uma ficha de criatura incolor 1/1 do tipo Rebento Eldrazi. Ela tem "Sacrifique esta criatura: Adicione {1} à sua reserva de mana.".Compre um card.

foreignNames.name: Могильное Порождение
foreignNames.text: Лишение (У этой карты нет цвета.)Целевой оппонент изгоняет карту из своего кладбища. Вы кладете на поле битвы одну фишку существа 1/1 бесцветный Эльдрази Отпрыск. Она имеет способность «Пожертвуйте это существо: добавьте {1} в ваше хранилище маны».Возьмите карту.

foreignNames.name: Eclosión sepulcral
foreignNames.text: Vacío. (Esta carta no tiene ningún color.)El oponente objetivo exilia una carta de su cementerio. Pon en el campo de batalla una ficha de criatura Vástago Eldrazi incolora 1/1. Tiene "Sacrificar esta criatura: Agrega {1} a tu reserva de maná".Roba una carta.

cards.name: Grave Birthing
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)Target opponent exiles a card from his or her graveyard. You put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."Draw a card.

rulings.text: The target opponent chooses which card to exile as Grave Birthing resolves.
You can cast Grave Birthing targeting an opponent with an empty graveyard. Even though that player won’t exile a card from his or her graveyard, you’ll still get an Eldrazi Scion and draw a card.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
Eldrazi Scions are similar to Eldrazi Spawn, seen in the Zendikar block. Note that Eldrazi Scions are 1/1, not 0/1.
Eldrazi and Scion are each separate creature types. Anything that affects Eldrazi will affect these tokens, for example.
Sacrificing an Eldrazi Scion creature token to add {1} to your mana pool is a mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.

Some instants and sorceries that create Eldrazi Scions require targets. If all targets for such a spell have become illegal by the time that spell tries to resolve, the spell will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t get any Eldrazi Scions.

cards.text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Target opponent exiles a card from his or her graveyard. You put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: As the hand closed, there was first terror, then numbness, and finally nothingness.

foreignNames.name: 荒芜之攫
foreignNames.text: 虚色（此牌没有颜色。）放逐目标生物与目标地。
foreignNames.flavor: 巨拳渐握，先是恐惧，进而麻痹，最后便是空无。

foreignNames.name: 荒蕪之攫
foreignNames.text: 虛色（此牌沒有顏色。）放逐目標生物與目標地。
foreignNames.flavor: 巨拳漸握，先是恐懼，進而麻痺，最後便是空無。

foreignNames.name: Poigne de la désolation
foreignNames.text: Carence (Cette carte n'a pas de couleur.)Exilez la créature ciblée et le terrain ciblé.
foreignNames.flavor: Quand le poing se serra, apparut d'abord la terreur, puis la torpeur, et enfin le néant.

foreignNames.name: Griff der Verödung
foreignNames.text: Fahl (Diese Karte hat keine Farbe.)Schicke eine Kreatur deiner Wahl und ein Land deiner Wahl ins Exil.
foreignNames.flavor: Als sich die Hand schloss, war da zuerst Todesangst, gefolgt von Taubheit, und letztendlich nur noch das Nichts.

foreignNames.name: Morsa della Desolazione
foreignNames.text: Vacuità (Questa carta non ha colore.)Esilia una creatura bersaglio e una terra bersaglio.
foreignNames.flavor: Quando la mano si chiuse, prima venne il terrore, poi il torpore, infine il nulla.

foreignNames.name: 荒廃の一掴み
foreignNames.text: 欠色（このカードは無色である。）クリーチャー１体と土地１つを対象とし、それらを追放する。
foreignNames.flavor: その手が閉じると、初めは恐怖を感じたが、すぐに何も感じなくなり、最後は無になった。

foreignNames.text: 결여 (이 카드는 무색이다.)생물과 대지를 각각 목표로 정한다. 그 목표들을 추방한다.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.

cards.name: Mind Raker
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)When Mind Raker enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, each opponent discards a card.

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
If a spell or ability requires that you put more than one exiled card into the graveyard, you may choose cards owned by different opponents. Each card chosen will be put into its owner’s graveyard.

If a replacement effect will cause cards that would be put into a graveyard from anywhere to be exiled instead (such as the one created by Anafenza, the Foremost), you can still put an exiled card into its opponent’s graveyard. The card becomes a new object and remains in exile. In this situation, you can’t use a single exiled card if required to put more than one exiled card into the graveyard. Conversely, you could use the same card in this situation if two separate spells or abilities each required you to put a single exiled card into its owner’s graveyard.
You can’t look at face-down cards in exile unless an effect allows you to.

Face-down cards in exile are grouped using two criteria: what caused them to be exiled face down and when they were exiled face down. If you want to put a face-down card in exile into its owner’s graveyard, you must first choose one of these groups and then choose a card from within that group at random. For example, say an artifact causes your opponent to exile his or her hand of three cards face down. Then on a later turn, that artifact causes your opponent to exile another two cards face down. If you use Wasteland Strangler to put one of those cards into his or her graveyard, you would pick the first or second pile and put a card chosen at random from that pile into the graveyard.

cards.text:

When Mind Raker enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, each opponent discards a card.

rulings.text: Once you legally activate the ability, it doesn’t matter what happens to the other colorless creature. The ability will resolve and create a regeneration shield even if you don’t control another colorless creature at that time.
Skitterskin’s activated ability doesn’t depend on Skitterskin being colorless. If it gains one or more colors, you can still activate the ability if you control another creature that’s colorless.

cards.name: Wasteland Strangler
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)When Wasteland Strangler enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
If a spell or ability requires that you put more than one exiled card into the graveyard, you may choose cards owned by different opponents. Each card chosen will be put into its owner’s graveyard.

If a replacement effect will cause cards that would be put into a graveyard from anywhere to be exiled instead (such as the one created by Anafenza, the Foremost), you can still put an exiled card into its opponent’s graveyard. The card becomes a new object and remains in exile. In this situation, you can’t use a single exiled card if required to put more than one exiled card into the graveyard. Conversely, you could use the same card in this situation if two separate spells or abilities each required you to put a single exiled card into its owner’s graveyard.
You can’t look at face-down cards in exile unless an effect allows you to.

Face-down cards in exile are grouped using two criteria: what caused them to be exiled face down and when they were exiled face down. If you want to put a face-down card in exile into its owner’s graveyard, you must first choose one of these groups and then choose a card from within that group at random. For example, say an artifact causes your opponent to exile his or her hand of three cards face down. Then on a later turn, that artifact causes your opponent to exile another two cards face down. If you use Wasteland Strangler to put one of those cards into his or her graveyard, you would pick the first or second pile and put a card chosen at random from that pile into the graveyard.

cards.name: Bloodbond Vampire
cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodbond Vampire.

rulings.text: The ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it’s 1 life from Drana’s Emissary or 7 life from Nissa’s Renewal.

A creature with lifelink dealing combat damage is a single life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures you control with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, the ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won’t cause the ability to trigger, even though it causes your team’s life total to increase.

cards.text: Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodbond Vampire.

cards.flavor: Vastly outnumbered, the Zendikari found creative ways to even the odds.

cards.name: Bone Splinters
cards.originalText: As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.Destroy target creature.

rulings.text: You could choose to target the creature you're going to sacrifice to pay for Bone Splinters. First you choose the target (at which time it's still on the battlefield), then you pay the costs (at which time you sacrifice it). The spell will be countered.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Carrier Thrall
cards.originalText: When Carrier Thrall dies, put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

rulings.text: Eldrazi Scions are similar to Eldrazi Spawn, seen in the Zendikar block. Note that Eldrazi Scions are 1/1, not 0/1.
Eldrazi and Scion are each separate creature types. Anything that affects Eldrazi will affect these tokens, for example.
Sacrificing an Eldrazi Scion creature token to add {1} to your mana pool is a mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.

Some instants and sorceries that create Eldrazi Scions require targets. If all targets for such a spell have become illegal by the time that spell tries to resolve, the spell will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t get any Eldrazi Scions.

cards.text: When Carrier Thrall dies, put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

For example, if two creatures you control with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, the ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.

cards.name: Drana, Liberator of Malakir
cards.originalText: Flying, first strikeWhenever Drana, Liberator of Malakir deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature you control.

rulings.text: Drana’s last ability triggers after combat damage has been dealt, so only attacking creatures that survive the combat damage step in which Drana deals combat damage will have +1/+1 counters put on them.

The +1/+1 counter won’t change how much damage Drana or any other attacking creature with first strike or double strike deals during that combat damage step. However, the +1/+1 counters that are put on attacking creatures without first strike will affect the damage those creatures deal during the regular combat damage step.

cards.name: Geyserfield Stalker
cards.originalText: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Geyserfield Stalker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.name: Kalastria Nightwatch
cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life, Kalastria Nightwatch gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it’s 1 life from Drana’s Emissary or 7 life from Nissa’s Renewal.

A creature with lifelink dealing combat damage is a single life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures you control with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, the ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won’t cause the ability to trigger, even though it causes your team’s life total to increase.

cards.name: Mire's Malice
cards.originalText: Target opponent discards two cards.Awaken 3—{5}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

rulings.text: You can cast a spell with awaken for its mana cost and get only its first effect. If you cast a spell for its awaken cost, you’ll get both effects.

If the non-awaken part of the spell requires a target, you must choose a legal target. You can’t cast the spell if you can’t choose a legal target for each instance of the word “target” (though you only need a legal target for the awaken ability if you’re casting the spell for its awaken cost).

If a spell with awaken has multiple targets (including the land you control), and some but not all of those targets become illegal by the time the spell tries to resolve, the spell won’t affect the illegal targets in any way.

If the non-awaken part of the spell doesn’t require a target and you cast the spell for its awaken cost, then the spell will be countered if the target land you control becomes illegal before the spell resolves (such as due to being destroyed in response to the spell being cast).

The land will retain any other types, subtypes, or supertypes it previously had. It will also retain any mana abilities it had as a result of those subtypes. For example, a Forest that’s turned into a creature this way can still be tapped for {G}.
Awaken doesn’t give the land you control a color. As most lands are colorless, in most cases the resulting land creature will also be colorless.

cards.text:

cards.name: Painful Truths
cards.originalText: Converge — You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Painful Truths.

rulings.text: The maximum number of colors of mana you can spend to cast a spell is five. Colorless is not a color. Note that the cost of a spell with converge may limit how many colors of mana you can spend.

If there are any alternative or additional costs to cast a spell with a converge ability, the mana spent to pay those costs will count. For example, if an effect makes sorcery spells cost {1} more to cast, you could pay {W}{U}{B}{R} to cast Radiant Flames and deal 4 damage to each creature.

If you cast a spell with converge without spending any mana to cast it (perhaps because an effect allowed you to cast it without paying its mana cost), then the number of colors spent to cast it will be zero.

If a spell with a converge ability is copied, no mana was spent to cast the copy, so the number of colors of mana spent to cast the spell will be zero. The number of colors spent to cast the original spell is not copied.

cards.name: Retreat to Hagra
cards.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —• Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.• Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.name: Rising Miasma
cards.originalText: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.Awaken 3—{5}{B}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}{B}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

rulings.text: If you cast Rising Miasma for its awaken cost, creatures will get -2/-2 before the land you targeted is turned into a creature. Unless it was already a land creature before Rising Miasma started resolving, it won’t get -2/-2.
You can cast a spell with awaken for its mana cost and get only its first effect. If you cast a spell for its awaken cost, you’ll get both effects.

If the non-awaken part of the spell requires a target, you must choose a legal target. You can’t cast the spell if you can’t choose a legal target for each instance of the word “target” (though you only need a legal target for the awaken ability if you’re casting the spell for its awaken cost).

If a spell with awaken has multiple targets (including the land you control), and some but not all of those targets become illegal by the time the spell tries to resolve, the spell won’t affect the illegal targets in any way.

If the non-awaken part of the spell doesn’t require a target and you cast the spell for its awaken cost, then the spell will be countered if the target land you control becomes illegal before the spell resolves (such as due to being destroyed in response to the spell being cast).

The land will retain any other types, subtypes, or supertypes it previously had. It will also retain any mana abilities it had as a result of those subtypes. For example, a Forest that’s turned into a creature this way can still be tapped for {G}.
Awaken doesn’t give the land you control a color. As most lands are colorless, in most cases the resulting land creature will also be colorless.

cards.name: Barrage Tyrant
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.){2}{R}, Sacrifice another colorless creature: Barrage Tyrant deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Barrage Tyrant deals the damage, not the sacrificed creature. For example, if the sacrificed creature had lifelink, you won’t gain life.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.

A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.

cards.name: Processor Assault
cards.originalText: Devoid (This card has no color.)As an additional cost to cast Processor Assault, put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard.Processor Assault deals 5 damage to target creature.

rulings.text: You must put exactly one card an opponent owns from exile into that player’s graveyard to cast Processor Assault. You can’t cast it without doing so, and you can’t put multiple exiled cards into their owners’ graveyards this way.
Players can respond to Processor Assault only after it’s been cast and all of its costs have been paid. No one can try to remove the card from exile to stop you from casting the spell.

Cards with devoid use frames that are variations of the transparent frame traditionally used for Eldrazi. The top part of the card features some color over a background based on the texture of the hedrons that once imprisoned the Eldrazi. This coloration is intended to aid deckbuilding and game play.
A card with devoid is just colorless. It’s not colorless and the colors of mana in its mana cost.
Other cards and abilities can give a card with devoid color. If that happens, it’s just the new color, not that color and colorless.
Devoid works in all zones, not just on the battlefield.
If a card loses devoid, it will still be colorless. This is because effects that change an object’s color (like the one created by devoid) are considered before the object loses devoid.
If a spell or ability requires that you put more than one exiled card into the graveyard, you may choose cards owned by different opponents. Each card chosen will be put into its owner’s graveyard.

If a replacement effect will cause cards that would be put into a graveyard from anywhere to be exiled instead (such as the one created by Anafenza, the Foremost), you can still put an exiled card into its opponent’s graveyard. The card becomes a new object and remains in exile. In this situation, you can’t use a single exiled card if required to put more than one exiled card into the graveyard. Conversely, you could use the same card in this situation if two separate spells or abilities each required you to put a single exiled card into its owner’s graveyard.
You can’t look at face-down cards in exile unless an effect allows you to.

Face-down cards in exile are grouped using two criteria: what caused them to be exiled face down and when they were exiled face down. If you want to put a face-down card in exile into its owner’s graveyard, you must first choose one of these groups and then choose a card from within that group at random. For example, say an artifact causes your opponent to exile his or her hand of three cards face down. Then on a later turn, that artifact causes your opponent to exile another two cards face down. If you use Wasteland Strangler to put one of those cards into his or her graveyard, you would pick the first or second pile and put a card chosen at random from that pile into the graveyard.
